item.title: Mattresses,building refuse,food, 3rd August
item.description:
Again more flytipping,perpetual.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Galahad Road, Downham, London

item.title: Rubbish front of my house, 3rd August
item.description:
Hello dear Sir/Madame Someone is constantly throwing black bags with garbage and furniture at the end of our street. Foxes rummage through everything there at night and the garbage is scattered around. I have already collected it several times and just this morning I collected it again in a pile, itâ€™s a pity I took a photo after I had already collected it. Worms are crawling there and the garbage is rotting. Why do people do this?! This is a dead-end street and I would like to know who throws out large garbage near my house. I have three small children and we are forced to watch this Could you please help us to remove this and do some camera to fine these people Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Congleton Grove, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs to be pruned, 3rd August
item.description:
Tree outside 26 and 28 Ryecroft Road is overgrown and needs to be cut back It is blocking the sunlight and is now too large for the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ryecroft Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Rubbish near 29 horsell road/95 midfield way, 3rd August
item.description:
2 weeks this rubbish bag has been left on grass outside and behind the fenceline of houses 29 Horsell road/95 midfield way and has now been torn open so litter is everywhere. Please can the rubbish bag be collected and scattered litter picked up. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Horsell Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Restaurant puts plant trough on the public carriageway, 3rd August
item.description:
Every evening the restaurant at 33 Craven roads puts their pots and other stuff on the public carriage way to increase their outdoor dining. This contributes to obstructing turning into the mews street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Craven Road, Paddington, London

item.title: Vegetation should be cut back., 3rd August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22A,22B,22C,22D, Sholden Gardens, Poverest, London

item.title: Mattress and rubbish in the alleyway, 3rd August
item.description:
This is the 4th time I have reported this. I cannot believe that it is no longer on the map. This has not been picked up. There is a double mattress, cardboard boxes. The alley has a lot of rubbish in it that as been there since the beginning of time (slightly exaggeration). Please please please remove the mattress and rubbish. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cantwell Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped vehicles, 3rd August
item.description:
Vehicles that have not moved since I reported the problem over a year ago 7 cars/vans from the same family taking up parking spaces making it hard to visit disabled member of the family And greenwich council are doing nothing about it, it's been over a year Give it a go and fo your job we all pay for

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walnut Tree Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sharp spike bushes, 3rd August
item.description:

item.title: Subject: Overgrown Grass Under Tree Outside My Property, 3rd August
item.description:
Dear Bexley Council, I am writing to report that the grass and weeds under the tree outside my property at 119 Elsa Rd, Welling, Kent, DA16 1JX have not been cleaned or maintained for some time. It is now overgrown and unsightly, and may soon become a safety or hygiene issue as rubbish is getting stuck in the grass. I would appreciate it if the area could be inspected and included in the next round of grass cutting and cleaning. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elsa Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
